name: ais
description: AI-powered terminal assistant that transforms command failures into learning opportunities. Automatically detects errors, analyzes context, and provides intelligent explanations with solutions. Stop Googling the same errors - start learning from them! ✨ Multi-AI support, privacy-first, zero-config shell integration.
readme_summary: AIS is an AI-powered terminal assistant that analyzes command failures and provides intelligent explanations and solutions. It integrates deeply with the shell to offer context-aware assistance, aiming to improve problem-solving efficiency and accelerate skill development for developers.
key_features: Intelligent Error Analysis (Automatic detection, Context awareness, Personalized suggestions, Safety levels)
Intelligent Learning System (Interactive teaching, Topic learning, Progressive content, Practice-oriented)
Intelligent Context Awareness (Environment-aware Q&A, Three-level context collection, System status analysis, Project-type recognition)
Strong Integrations (Shell integration, Multi-AI support, Privacy protection, Cross-platform)
primary_use_case: To provide real-time, AI-driven assistance within the terminal environment, helping users understand and resolve command errors, and learn related concepts.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a seasoned explorer in a digital jungle, using a high-tech compass to navigate through dense foliage of error messages. The compass, representing AIS, glows with AI, highlighting the correct path through the errors. The explorer holds a tablet displaying contextual information about the environment. The jungle floor is littered with discarded 'Google search' scrolls. Small UI elements show code snippets and error analysis data. The scene is set in a vibrant, stylized jungle with glowing plants and digital particles. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and a playful color scheme.

name: subarr
description: "Sonarr for YouTube" - a tool to periodically check various YouTube playlists and take actions when new videos are posted
readme_summary: Subarr is a lightweight JavaScript application designed to monitor YouTube channels and playlists for new video uploads. It allows users to define actions, such as sending webhooks or executing processes (like downloading via yt-dlp), when new content is detected, providing a Sonarr-like experience for YouTube subscriptions.
key_features: YouTube channel/playlist monitoring
Webhook notifications on new uploads
Process execution on new uploads (e.g., yt-dlp)
Lightweight resource usage (suitable for Raspberry Pi)
RSS subscription based
primary_use_case: Automating actions based on new YouTube uploads from subscribed channels/playlists.
cover_image_prompt: An organized librarian meticulously shelving newly arrived video reels onto labeled shelves in a vast, digital library. Each shelf represents a YouTube channel or playlist. The librarian uses a magnifying glass to inspect each reel, ensuring it's correctly categorized. Small screens embedded in the shelves display the latest video titles and upload dates. Digital particles flow from the reels, representing data being processed. The repository name, 'Subarr,' is subtly displayed on the librarian's desk. The scene is in a 3D isometric illustration style with bright, organized colors.

name: gonzo
description: Gonzo! The Go based TUI log analysis tool

name: filestash
description: :file_folder: The Dropbox like web client for SFTP, S3, FTP, WebDAV, Git, Minio, LDAP, CalDAV, CardDAV, Mysql, Backblaze, ...

name: unhype
description: Browser extension to unhype/neutralise headers on the web
readme_summary: The unhype browser extension neutralizes or 'unhypes' clickbait-style headers on web pages. It allows users to configure which elements on a page are processed using CSS selectors and connects to an LLM to rewrite the selected text in a more neutral tone. The extension supports multiple LLM providers, including Ollama, OpenRouter, and Mistral AI.
key_features: Unhypes/neutralizes web page headers
Configurable CSS selectors for content processing
Integration with multiple LLM providers (Ollama, OpenRouter, Mistral AI)
LLM connection status indicator
Manual installation option via zip archive
primary_use_case: Neutralizing sensationalized or clickbait headlines on web pages to provide a more objective browsing experience.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously replacing sensational book titles with neutral, factual summaries. The librarian uses a special tool that connects to a glowing server rack in the background, representing the LLM. Small screens display the original clickbait titles and the rewritten versions. The scene is set in a quiet, modern library with soft lighting. Digital particles flow from the server rack to the librarian's tool, symbolizing the data transformation. The repository name, 'Unhype,' is subtly displayed on a book spine. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a calming color scheme.

name: ScreenCoder
description: ScreenCoder — Turn any UI screenshot into clean, editable HTML/CSS with full control. Fast, accurate, and easy to customize.
readme_summary: ScreenCoder is an intelligent UI-to-code generation system that transforms UI screenshots or design mockups into clean, production-ready HTML/CSS code. It uses a modular multi-agent architecture, combining visual understanding, layout planning, and adaptive code synthesis to produce accurate and editable front-end code, allowing for customized modifications.
key_features: Transforms UI screenshots into HTML/CSS code
Modular multi-agent architecture
Visual understanding
Layout planning
Adaptive code synthesis
Customizable modifications
Post-training code (SFT + RL) released
ScreenBench: benchmark for visual-to-code/web UI generation
primary_use_case: Generating HTML/CSS code from UI screenshots or design mockups for rapid prototyping or building pixel-perfect interfaces.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect meticulously crafting a digital blueprint from a photograph of a building's facade. The architect uses a specialized stylus to trace the image, which is then instantly converted into clean, editable HTML/CSS code displayed on a holographic screen. Small UI elements and code snippets float around the architect, subtly connecting the design process to software development. The scene is set in a bright, modern studio with a focus on precision and efficiency. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear details and a vibrant color scheme.

name: TGConvertor
description: Convert Telegram session files between Pyrogram, Kurigram, Telethon and TDATA formats. Simple, fast, and CLI-friendly.
